text: so LeapFrog is the world's first fund
focused on micro Insurance and financial
inclusion for the poor it is a
for-profit private Equity Fund but we
believe that this is a tremendous asset
class that is able to generate strong
returns for investors while also lifting
millions of people out of poverty and
why is that well there are some
incredibly exciting Insurance businesses
out there and those businesses have
often been serving the middle class but
the middle class has sometimes become
saturated or it's not the most exciting
opportunity low-income people Express a
very strong demand for micro insurance
so several of my partners did a study
that is 100 Country Landscape study of
micro Insurance in the world's 100
poorest countries and it shows that
there are a billion people out there who
are willing and able to pay for micro
insurance you have a market of a billion
people and it is 3%
penetrated now the opportunity there and
the demand is intensive because people
lie awake at night worrying they're
going to lose everything the demand for
microc credit may be stronger because
people want to be entrepreneurs or have
consumption needs but almost everybody
lies awake at night if you're poor
worrying you're going to lose everything
so there are a billion people waiting to
consume this product and insurers have
just been slow to recognize this
opportunity and act on it now what we as
LeapFrog do is invest in exciting
businesses in Africa and Asia that serve
lowincome and poor people with micro
insurance that meet this incredibly
intensive demand and they're very
exciting and Innovative businesses and
we provide them with the capital and the
expertise because several of my partners
are some of the world's leading
authorities on micro Insurance
Distribution on uh product design and
pricing on all these different areas uh
and the expertise to help them grow
dramatically now the exciting thing
about this is it doesn't just apply to
poor people it also applies to people
who are excluded for other reasons
people who have disabilities people who
have HIV AIDS or diabetes that is severe
and can't get insurance now when someone
can't get insurance they often can't get
a home loan they often can't get entry
to the economy they often struggle to
get the the medications they need so
this intervention helping poor
low-income and financially excluded
people to get insurance is both hugely
important and it can be very profitable
and what LeapFrog does is it puts these
two things together it is a profit with
purpose firm and I believe it represents
the next Frontier for uh uh for
investment in the sense that you can
generate both social and financial
returns you don't have to choose as a
person between having money and having
meaning and I think all of us feel that
we would like to bring those two things
together why should you have to have
these terrible trade-offs between the
two and you can uh
Enga engage in a business that has
non-market tracking
returns because this is a very different
asset class from all the others out
there in including alternative asset
classes and at the same time feel that
you're helping millions of people to get
out of poverty and that's why we're so
passionate about Leap Frog and why
President Clinton uh and the Wall Street
Journal and other great uh organizations
have got behind us and are supporting us
it really is a group effort we we need
uh uh it's it's because it is so
Innovative we need the support of many
many different
people micro Insurance products can
sometimes be less than a dollar a year
and sometimes can be10 or $15 a month it
really just depends on the country the
income level and the nature of the
product uh so for instance in South
Africa for 4 to $7 uh you can get a life
insurance product where if the uh person
or their spouse or their child dies
there's a payout of say around
$750 now that is a lot of money for a
poor person uh who would otherwise might
be left destitute so we yes we're
interested in life insurance above all
because we think it's hugely important
and because it can be done very
profitably health insurance which is
much harder because you have to have a
health infrastructure that can can deal
with it uh and there's all sorts of
moral hazards but it is the most
demanded insurance and it's something we
really want to support um there is uh
there are all sorts of other kinds of
insurance uh accidental death and
disability insurance uh there is even
low-income housing Insurance uh and crop
insurance and other kinds of index-based
insurance so we we think that the
majority of our investments will be in
life insurance but we think that uh and
we're excited about several health
insurance opportunities but we think
there is room there for uh Investments
across these areas and we actually like
many other firms we actually hope that
there are a thousand leap frogs that
bloom uh to mix the metaphors because we
think it is such a huge Market that uh
many many players can come into the
sector and do this profitably
collaborate together and we're already
seeing large firms like aliance uh like
Zurich like AIG entering the micro
Insurance space uh in a more significant
way and seeing the opportunity here and
seeing their policy holders bases grow
dramatically in numbers well beyond
their middle class uh customer growth
and so I I think what we're on the cusp
of is the burgeoning of a whole new era
in which micro insurance is going to be
brought to low-income people globally
and Leap Frog hopes to lead that
charge
